htmlEmbed:
The US Can Make Bitcoin Mining GreenerCoinDesk0/19/2021

With companies like Square announcing environment-focused mining initiatives, the U.S. can take the lead in reducing bitcoin's carbon impact.

Mining, Opinion, PolicyRead

class="article-bodystyles__StyledWrapper-sc-5qmdhl-0 gYdxSV"><div id="mobile-overlay" class="Box-sc-1hpkeeg-0 bzyqtz"></div><section class="at-body"><div class="main-body-grid"><div class="authors-block"><div class="author-blockstyles__StyledWrapper-sc-1t3hl0h-0 cgSPLt"><div class="at-author-block layout-column"><div><div><a href="/author/James Cooper/"><div class="img-wrapper"><img src="https://downloads.coindesk.com/cd3/author-placeholder.png"/></div></a></div><div><div class="name"><p class="typography__StyledTypography-owin6q-0 dOhMzS"><a href="/author/James Cooper/">James Cooper</a></p></div></div></div><div><div class="description"><p class="typography__StyledTypography-owin6q-0 lkUGSO"></p></div></div></div></div></div><div><div class="contentstyle__StyledWrapper-g5cdrh-0 cQofyD"><div class="textstyles__StyledWrapper-sc-1si5v8z-0 dWbcyi"><div class="at-text"><div class="typography__StyledTypography-owin6q-0 cpyiON"><p><p>The incoming administration of Joe Biden has an opportunity to take the global lead in green mining for digital assets. <a rel="noreferrer noopener" href="/markets/2020/12/28/that-decoupling-sound-china-the-us-and-a-year-of-cbdcs/" target="_blank">It is no secret that there is a geopolitical struggle</a> brewing over new forms of cryptocurrencies  both state-backed and private  and the best location for new capital formation and technological advancements. To win this global competition, the new U.S. government must ensure more regulatory clarity for digital assets while also ensuring that the mining process, a <a href="https://twitter.com/smdiehl/status/1350869944888664064" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">tremendous drain on energy resources</a> and a contributor to global warming, is done in an environmentally sensitive way.</p></p></div></div></div><div class="textstyles__StyledWrapper-sc-1si5v8z-0 dWbcyi"><div class="at-text"><div class="typography__StyledTypography-owin6q-0 cpyiON"><p><p>Some of the new administrations leaders should work together to make policies to encourage development in this burgeoning industry. <a href="https://news.yahoo.com/exclusive-biden-name-gary-gensler-194742599.html" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">The expected ascension of Gary Gensler</a>, a former chairman of the Commodity Futures Trading Commission, to lead the Securities and Exchange Commission augurs well for a more enlightened and proactive approach by regulators concerning digital assets. After all, he just finished teaching a course on blockchain at MIT, sees the technology as a <a href="/tech/2019/12/15/even-if-a-thousand-projects-dont-make-it-blockchain-is-still-a-change-catalyst/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">catalyst for change,</a> and is <a href="https://www.nasdaq.com/articles/bitcoin-friendly-gary-gensler-tapped-for-bidens-financial-policy-transition-team-2020-11" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">viewed as a threat to the legacy financial system</a>. Thats all good for the disruptive financial technologies. </p></p></div></div></div><div class="block-quotestyles__StyledWrapper-sc-9k84cn-0 eSLfzk"><div class="at-block-quote"><div class="typography__StyledTypography-owin6q-0 kMYIJA"><div class="at-block-quote-el"><span>James Cooper is a Professor of Law and Associate Dean of Experiential Learning at California Western School of Law. He is moderating <a href="https://us02web.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_5EL2cgyAQ3mv6yytYhKLSA" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">a panel for Digital Davos</a> on Jan. 20 on ethics and technologies in developing countries.</span></div></div></div></div><div class="textstyles__StyledWrapper-sc-1si5v8z-0 dWbcyi"><div class="at-text"><div class="typography__StyledTypography-owin6q-0 cpyiON"><p><p>Also, <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/11/23/politics/john-kerry-biden-climate-envoy/index.html" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">the naming of former Secretary of State John Kerry</a> to a cabinet-level position as Special Presidential Envoy for Climate, is a signal of the new administrations commitment to tackling global climate change. He understands the importance of cryptocurrency. At the World Economic Forum three years ago this week, Kerry was quoted as saying cryptocurrency has <a href="https://www.bitcoininsider.org/article/15271/comments-john-kerry-jamie-dimon-show-davos-apathetic-view-cryptocurrency">got value.</a> Together, these two appointees can ensure the country leads fintech development while preventing crypto mining from contributing to more greenhouse gases.  </p></p></div></div></div><div class="textstyles__StyledWrapper-sc-1si5v8z-0 dWbcyi"><div class="at-text"><div class="typography__StyledTypography-owin6q-0 cpyiON"><p><p>A raft of projects abroad are already primed for success in the green mining space and can act as models for the United States. In 2019, Bitfury set up mining centers in Paraguay, home to South Americas biggest hydro-electric project  the Itaipu Dam  <a href="https://www.itaipu.gov.br/en" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">the worlds largest generator of renewable clean energy</a>. The government in Asuncin has backed the Commons Foundations <a href="https://commons.foundation/page/projects?mode=view&SEQ=2" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">Golden Goose project</a>, in its attempt to establish the region as the worlds largest crypto mining center. But there is a challenge to keep the Paraguay project itself from contributing to greenhouse gases given the intense heat that the tropical country faces year round. It would be counter-productive to use a lot of energy to cool the computers even if the energy was being produced by renewable sources.</p></p></div></div></div><div class="textstyles__StyledWrapper-sc-1si5v8z-0 dWbcyi"><div class="at-text"><div class="typography__StyledTypography-owin6q-0 cpyiON"><p><p><b><i>See also: Jeff Bandman - <a href="/policy/2021/01/14/what-crypto-can-expect-from-gary-gensler-at-the-sec/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">What Crypto Can Expect From Gary Gensler at the SEC</a></i></b></p></p></div></div></div><div class="textstyles__StyledWrapper-sc-1si5v8z-0 dWbcyi"><div class="at-text"><div class="typography__StyledTypography-owin6q-0 cpyiON"><p><p>Cost-effective mining centers based on renewable energy have also been established in Russias frozen lands of <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/av/world-europe-46634596" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">Siberia</a>. The city of Norilsk is home to the mineral mining behemoth Norilsk Nickel but increasingly <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/photo-essays/2021-01-14/bitcoin-btc-usd-cryptocurrency-mining-comes-to-arctic-circle-photos" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">bitcoin mining is becoming an important economic driver.</a> With temperatures in winter bottoming out at minus 40 degrees Celsius (which is roughly minus 40 degrees Fahrenheit), this is a perfect climate by which to keep computing machines cool. Its a lot cooler than Paraguay for sure.  </p></p></div></div></div><div class="textstyles__StyledWrapper-sc-1si5v8z-0 dWbcyi"><div class="at-text"><div class="typography__StyledTypography-owin6q-0 cpyiON"><p><p>Nor should we forget about China, the home to over half the <a href="/price/bitcoin" data-for="autolink" data-tip="BTC">bitcoin</a> miners in the world, the majority of whom are situated in Sichuan due to low energy costs, powered by hydro-electric facilities. That the area has recently suffered some of the worst flooding in 70 years, largely due to climate change, shows that irony is as much at play here as hash rates. Poolin, which controls the majority of BTC hash rate, has had trouble with consistent energy supplies and some of its mining farms have been inundated by monsoon floods. Even with the provinces vast hydro-electric capabilities, the authorities in the Peoples Republic of China have generally banned the digital asset industry  shuttering mining, exchanges and industry conferences.  </p></p></div></div></div><div class="textstyles__StyledWrapper-sc-1si5v8z-0 dWbcyi"><div class="at-text"><div class="typography__StyledTypography-owin6q-0 cpyiON"><p><p>A more secure and geographically proximate project is rolling out near the Churchill Falls hydro-electric plant in Labrador, a remote part of Eastern Canada. <a href="https://pow.re/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">Pow.re</a>, a Montreal-based company with investors from Asia, is taking advantage of the stranded energy that NL Hydro generates. This hydro-electric facility is long past emitting mercury traces, so the project meets many environmental protection and sustainable development goals. The temperature rarely exceeds 60 degrees Fahrenheit in the summer, ensuring that the machines stay cool. The only source of waste is heat  which is a luxury in the sub-Arctic region where they are mining. </p></p></div></div></div><div class="textstyles__StyledWrapper-sc-1si5v8z-0 dWbcyi"><div class="at-text"><div class="typography__StyledTypography-owin6q-0 cpyiON"><p><p><b><i>See also: <a href="/policy/2021/01/19/state-of-crypto-what-the-crypto-world-should-watch-for-in-the-biden-era/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">State of Crypto: What the Crypto World Should Watch for in the Biden Era</a></i></b></p></p></div></div></div><div class="textstyles__StyledWrapper-sc-1si5v8z-0 dWbcyi"><div class="at-text"><div class="typography__StyledTypography-owin6q-0 cpyiON"><p><p>The United States has much to learn from such foreign green mining projects. There are some new initiatives to encourage bitcoin mining stateside (including <a href="https://apps.legislature.ky.gov/recorddocuments/bill/21RS/hb230/orig_bill.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">a new legislative bill in Kentucky to provide state tax incentives</a>), but many of these are not green and may contribute to the earths warming. <a href="https://www.eia.gov/state/analysis.php?sid=KY#:~:text=Renewable%20energy.%20Renewable%20resources%20are%20a%20relatively%20small,almost%20all%20of%20the%20state%27s%20renewable%20electricity%20generation." target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">Coal-fired power plants supply 73% of Kentuckys electrical generation</a>, for example, dulling the greenness of that project. (Layer1's mining project in Texas, by contrast, is <a rel="noreferrer noopener" href="/policy/2020/09/18/money-reimagined-climate-friendlier-crypto/" target="_blank">prized</a> for its environmental performance.)</p></p></div></div></div><div class="textstyles__StyledWrapper-sc-1si5v8z-0 dWbcyi"><div class="at-text"><div class="typography__StyledTypography-owin6q-0 cpyiON"><p><p>And while bountiful and clean electricity are critical to providing hash rates that are cost effective and have little environmental impact, so are champions in major policy-making positions. The combination of Gensler and Kerry in the Biden administration can help position the United States at the forefront of green mining. President Biden promised to "build back better."Green mining is one such way. Private companies are getting in on this opportunity too: <a rel="noreferrer noopener" href="/markets/2020/12/08/blockchain-bites-squares-green-bitcoin-pledge-15b-aum-in-crypto-funds/" target="_blank">Square Crypto recently announced a $10 million fund</a> to promote projects that use green energy for bitcoin mining.</p></p></div></div></div><div class="textstyles__StyledWrapper-sc-1si5v8z-0 dWbcyi"><div class="at-text"><div class="typography__StyledTypography-owin6q-0 cpyiON"><p><p>The U.S. government has much to gain by providing regulatory clarity for fintech and environmentally sound policies for cryptocurrency mining. If it does not, there are plenty of other countries to take the lead and profit accordingly.</p></p></div></div></div></div><div class="disclaimerstyles__StyledWrapper-sc-7v0lzn-0 gqHNxQ"><p class="typography__StyledTypography-owin6q-0 YyNIL disclosure">DISCLOSURE</p><div class="at-disclamer"><p class="typography__StyledTypography-owin6q-0 iYKxoB">The leader in news and information on cryptocurrency, digital assets and the future of money, CoinDesk is a media outlet that strives for the highest journalistic standards and abides by a<!-- --> <a href="/ethics/" class="link__Link-lw0p1v-0 tatPI">strict set of editorial policies</a>. type="application/javascript">window.Fusion=window.Fusion||{};Fusion.arcSite="coindesk";Fusion.contextPath="/pf";Fusion.deployment="132";Fusion.globalContent={"content":{"type":"story","_id":"RE6ZA574XZGIPFFRM463KVCYEY","website_url":"/policy/2021/01/19/the-us-can-make-bitcoin-mining-greener/","canonical_url":"/policy/2021/01/19/the-us-can-make-bitcoin-mining-greener/","content_elements":[{"_id":"NUHQCJIXGVC4ZJRIQSGRTUJFPQ","type":"text","content":"\n<p>The incoming administration of Joe Biden has an opportunity to take the global lead in green mining for digital assets. <a rel=\"noreferrer noopener\" href=\"/markets/2020/12/28/that-decoupling-sound-china-the-us-and-a-year-of-cbdcs/\" target=\"_blank\">It is no secret that there is a geopolitical struggle</a> brewing over new forms of cryptocurrencies  both state-backed and private  and the best location for new capital formation and technological advancements. To win this global competition, the new U.S. government must ensure more regulatory clarity for digital assets while also ensuring that the mining process, a <a href=\"https://twitter.com/smdiehl/status/1350869944888664064\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">tremendous drain on energy resources</a> and a contributor to global warming, is done in an environmentally sensitive way.</p>\n"},{"_id":"UJPXO2DANVHPHCKRYVNRK65QDY","type":"text","content":"\n<p>Some of the new administrations leaders should work together to make policies to encourage development in this burgeoning industry. <a href=\"https://news.yahoo.com/exclusive-biden-name-gary-gensler-194742599.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">The expected ascension of Gary Gensler</a>, a former chairman of the Commodity Futures Trading Commission, to lead the Securities and Exchange Commission augurs well for a more enlightened and proactive approach by regulators concerning digital assets. After all, he just finished teaching a course on blockchain at MIT, sees the technology as a <a href=\"/tech/2019/12/15/even-if-a-thousand-projects-dont-make-it-blockchain-is-still-a-change-catalyst/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">catalyst for change,</a> and is <a href=\"https://www.nasdaq.com/articles/bitcoin-friendly-gary-gensler-tapped-for-bidens-financial-policy-transition-team-2020-11\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">viewed as a threat to the legacy financial system</a>. Thats all good for the disruptive financial technologies. </p>\n"},{"_id":"726NBAXX3ZHUBBUQEQXFXU45LE","type":"quote","content_elements":[{"_id":"HQ6HY6ZPEZAJFLKBL4D2RTSXQM","content":"James Cooper is a Professor of Law and Associate Dean of Experiential Learning at California Western School of Law. He is moderating <a href=\"https://us02web.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_5EL2cgyAQ3mv6yytYhKLSA\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">a panel for Digital Davos</a> on Jan. 20 on ethics and technologies in developing countries.","type":"text"}],"subtype":"blockquote"},{"_id":"BER3DH4MO5CDZGDXPR7VO4XKDY","type":"text","content":"\n<p>Also, <a href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/11/23/politics/john-kerry-biden-climate-envoy/index.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">the naming of former Secretary of State John Kerry</a> to a cabinet-level position as Special Presidential Envoy for Climate, is a signal of the new administrations commitment to tackling global climate change. He understands the importance of cryptocurrency. At the World Economic Forum three years ago this week, Kerry was quoted as saying cryptocurrency has <a href=\"https://www.bitcoininsider.org/article/15271/comments-john-kerry-jamie-dimon-show-davos-apathetic-view-cryptocurrency\">got value.</a> Together, these two appointees can ensure the country leads fintech development while preventing crypto mining from contributing to more greenhouse gases.  </p>\n"},{"_id":"7EBOKVMR4NGBRNYRKKHBLTLRGI","type":"text","content":"\n<p>A raft of projects abroad are already primed for success in the green mining space and can act as models for the United States. In 2019, Bitfury set up mining centers in Paraguay, home to South Americas biggest hydro-electric project  the Itaipu Dam  <a href=\"https://www.itaipu.gov.br/en\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">the worlds largest generator of renewable clean energy</a>. The government in Asuncin has backed the Commons Foundations <a href=\"https://commons.foundation/page/projects?mode=view&SEQ=2\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">Golden Goose project</a>, in its attempt to establish the region as the worlds largest crypto mining center. But there is a challenge to keep the Paraguay project itself from contributing to greenhouse gases given the intense heat that the tropical country faces year round. It would be counter-productive to use a lot of energy to cool the computers even if the energy was being produced by renewable sources.</p>\n"},{"_id":"DARXSFALANHHTKT4FFDOVZV5BM","type":"text","content":"\n<p><b><i>See also: Jeff Bandman - <a href=\"/policy/2021/01/14/what-crypto-can-expect-from-gary-gensler-at-the-sec/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">What Crypto Can Expect From Gary Gensler at the SEC</a></i></b></p>\n"},{"_id":"R3JLSTIXWFDGFASGZKUTD2IYFU","type":"text","content":"\n<p>Cost-effective mining centers based on renewable energy have also been established in Russias frozen lands of <a href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/av/world-europe-46634596\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">Siberia</a>. The city of Norilsk is home to the mineral mining behemoth Norilsk Nickel but increasingly <a href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/photo-essays/2021-01-14/bitcoin-btc-usd-cryptocurrency-mining-comes-to-arctic-circle-photos\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">bitcoin mining is becoming an important economic driver.</a> With temperatures in winter bottoming out at minus 40 degrees Celsius (which is roughly minus 40 degrees Fahrenheit), this is a perfect climate by which to keep computing machines cool. Its a lot cooler than Paraguay for sure.  </p>\n"},{"_id":"56YVIO24W5C2LFYAEQTF7RZMVQ","type":"text","content":"\n<p>Nor should we forget about China, the home to over half the <a href=\"/price/bitcoin\" data-for=\"autolink\" data-tip=\"BTC\">bitcoin</a> miners in the world, the majority of whom are situated in Sichuan due to low energy costs, powered by hydro-electric facilities. That the area has recently suffered some of the worst flooding in 70 years, largely due to climate change, shows that irony is as much at play here as hash rates. Poolin, which controls the majority of BTC hash rate, has had trouble with consistent energy supplies and some of its mining farms have been inundated by monsoon floods. Even with the provinces vast hydro-electric capabilities, the authorities in the Peoples Republic of China have generally banned the digital asset industry  shuttering mining, exchanges and industry conferences.  </p>\n"},{"_id":"O4Q5QHSI7BDP3DDOFRQY7MAJCE","type":"text","content":"\n<p>A more secure and geographically proximate project is rolling out near the Churchill Falls hydro-electric plant in Labrador, a remote part of Eastern Canada. <a href=\"https://pow.re/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">Pow.re</a>, a Montreal-based company with investors from Asia, is taking advantage of the stranded energy that NL Hydro generates. This hydro-electric facility is long past emitting mercury traces, so the project meets many environmental protection and sustainable development goals. The temperature rarely exceeds 60 degrees Fahrenheit in the summer, ensuring that the machines stay cool. The only source of waste is heat  which is a luxury in the sub-Arctic region where they are mining. </p>\n"},{"_id":"MMA7IYP5I5EL3PHIKE33BY35D4","type":"text","content":"\n<p><b><i>See also: <a href=\"/policy/2021/01/19/state-of-crypto-what-the-crypto-world-should-watch-for-in-the-biden-era/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">State of Crypto: What the Crypto World Should Watch for in the Biden Era</a></i></b></p>\n"},{"_id":"JK2SP7NE5VHY7KBFFCW7PRO7MY","type":"text","content":"\n<p>The United States has much to learn from such foreign green mining projects. There are some new initiatives to encourage bitcoin mining stateside (including <a href=\"https://apps.legislature.ky.gov/recorddocuments/bill/21RS/hb230/orig_bill.pdf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">a new legislative bill in Kentucky to provide state tax incentives</a>), but many of these are not green and may contribute to the earths warming. <a href=\"https://www.eia.gov/state/analysis.php?sid=KY#:~:text=Renewable%20energy.%20Renewable%20resources%20are%20a%20relatively%20small,almost%20all%20of%20the%20state%27s%20renewable%20electricity%20generation.\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noreferrer noopener\">Coal-fired power plants supply 73% of Kentuckys electrical generation</a>, for example, dulling the greenness of that project. (Layer1's mining project in Texas, by contrast, is <a rel=\"noreferrer noopener\" href=\"/policy/2020/09/18/money-reimagined-climate-friendlier-crypto/\" target=\"_blank\">prized</a> for its environmental performance.)</p>\n"},{"_id":"DQX2EVJWBFFCPGZY6ZY7Y6OONY","type":"text","content":"\n<p>And while bountiful and clean electricity are critical to providing hash rates that are cost effective and have little environmental impact, so are champions in major policy-making positions. The combination of Gensler and Kerry in the Biden administration can help position the United States at the forefront of green mining. President Biden promised to \"build back better.\"Green mining is one such way. Private companies are getting in on this opportunity too: <a rel=\"noreferrer noopener\" href=\"/markets/2020/12/08/blockchain-bites-squares-green-bitcoin-pledge-15b-aum-in-crypto-funds/\" target=\"_blank\">Square Crypto recently announced a $10 million fund</a> to promote projects that use green energy for bitcoin mining.</p>\n"},{"_id":"PUUQLVOB5BA5NK4Y43CZIPTRFM","type":"text","content":"\n<p>The U.S. government has much to gain by providing regulatory clarity for fintech and environmentally sound policies for cryptocurrency mining. If it does not, there are plenty of other countries to take the lead and profit December."},{"_id":"NTLC6OU2ZBEO3DQFR5A5ADRST4","type":"text","additional_properties":{"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"According to data from CoinMarketCap, LUNA was up 25% over the previous 24 hours. As of press time, the token had pulled back a bit to $102. LUNA has now more than doubled in price since putting in a 2022 low of about $44 in late January. Its current valuation just shy of $38 billion makes it the sixth-largest cryptocurrency by market cap."},{"_id":"MWTCTR62CNFELMCCBZIQQ4P5BM","type":"text","additional_properties":{"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"LUNAs new milestone makes it an outlier among large-cap cryptocurrencies, with names like Bitcoin (BTC), Ethereum (ETH), Cardano (ADA), Binance (BNB), Avalanche (AVAX) and Solana (SOL) down 40-70% from all-time highs."},{"_id":"5KEICKDSIFAWFJVASV4LAQCMIA","type":"text","additional_properties":{"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"<b>The LUNA/UST relationship</b>"},{"_id":"HCLF536QEZF3BGYWMM33KBDD3Q","type":"text","additional_properties":{"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"The gains for LUNA are likely thanks to strong demand for sister token TerraUSD (UST), an algorithmic stablecoin pegged to the US dollar."},{"_id":"2OLOS2OIY5AADCUDKCK5LCDUJA","type":"text","additional_properties":{"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"UST maintains its dollar peg by burning or issuing LUNA tokens. When the value of UST drops below $1 (for example, to $0.98), holders of UST can convert UST to $1 worth of LUNA (therefore, arbitrageurs can pocket the $0.02 difference)."},{"_id":"ZTWBO6XSSBGXDMJ4ACPULIRRYY","type":"text","additional_properties":{"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Conversely, if - as appears to be occurring now - demand for UST drives the price of the token over $1, users can mint additional UST (driving the price of UST back down to $1) by burning the dollar-equivalent amount of LUNA. This burning of LUNA tokens to create UST drives up the price of LUNA."},{"_id":"XQI6ZQWLPZDDZELFYRSDMGZ53Y","type":"text","additional_properties":{"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"<b>Anchor Protocol driving UST demand</b>"},{"_id":"R42CQUT5WJFN7EILBQ7A3LHDOE","type":"text","additional_properties":{"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Behind that <a href=\"https://www.coindesk.com/markets/2022/03/03/anchor-protocols-anc-rallies-23-heres-why/\">strong demand is</a> Terras Anchor Protocol, a decentralized finance (DeFi) platform advertising an annualized percentage yield (APY) of nearly 20% on Terra stablecoins. That high yield compared to other stablecoin lending protocols has attracted an influx of capital into Terra in recent weeks. The total value locked (TVL) on the platform soared to $12.6 billion, making it the largest DeFi protocol by TVL in the Terra ecosystem, according to data provider DeFi Llama."},{"_id":"HBRHWGFNDVAIPBFROZCHO2ORFE","type":"text","additional_properties":{"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Anchor is currently paying out a 19.46% APY for users that lock up their UST in the protocol. The Luna Foundation Guard (LFG) tweeted last Saturday that it was minting the maximum amount of UST to keep up with demand."},{"type":"oembed_response","subtype":"twitter","_id":"G2EXNF5XV5AWVEB3NAMNQZTPEE","raw_oembed":{"url":"https://twitter.com/LFG_org/status/1500002957529690114","author_name":"LFG | Luna Foundation Guard","author_url":"https://twitter.com/LFG_org","html":"<blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\"><p lang=\"en\" dir=\"ltr\">Due to the high demand in UST, the maximum amount is being minted by the protocol everyday. Antonopoulos. \n\nFinding early success with the show, Adam transformed the podcast's homepage into a full newsdesk and publishing platform, founding the LTB Network in January of 2014 to help broaden the conversation with new and different perspectives. In the Spring of that year, he would go on to launch the first and largest tokenized rewards program for creators and their audience. In what many have called an early influential version of \"Steemit\"; LTBCOIN, which was awarded to both content creators and members of the audience for participation was distributed until the LTBN was acquired by BTC, Inc. in January of 2017.\n\nWith the network launched and growing, in late 2014 Adam turned his attention to the practical challenges of administering the tokenized program and founded Tokenly, Inc. There, he led the development of early tokenized vending machines with Swapbot, tokenized identity solution Tokenpass, e-commerce with TokenMarkets.com and media with Token.fm. LUNA (LUNA) token rose to as high as $104.58 on Wednesday morning, topping a previous all-time record of $103.34 notched last December."},{"_id":"NTLC6OU2ZBEO3DQFR5A5ADRST4","type":"text","additional_properties":{"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"According to data from CoinMarketCap, LUNA was up 25% over the previous 24 hours. As of press time, the token had pulled back a bit to $102. LUNA has now more than doubled in price since putting in a 2022 low of about $44 in late January. Its current valuation just shy of $38 billion makes it the sixth-largest cryptocurrency by market cap."},{"_id":"MWTCTR62CNFELMCCBZIQQ4P5BM","type":"text","additional_properties":{"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"LUNAs new milestone makes it an outlier among large-cap cryptocurrencies, with names like Bitcoin (BTC), Ethereum (ETH), Cardano (ADA), Binance (BNB), Avalanche (AVAX) and Solana (SOL) down 40-70% from all-time highs."},{"_id":"5KEICKDSIFAWFJVASV4LAQCMIA","type":"text","additional_properties":{"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"<b>The LUNA/UST relationship</b>"},{"_id":"HCLF536QEZF3BGYWMM33KBDD3Q","type":"text","additional_properties":{"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"The gains for LUNA are likely thanks to strong demand for sister token TerraUSD (UST), an algorithmic stablecoin pegged to the US dollar."},{"_id":"2OLOS2OIY5AADCUDKCK5LCDUJA","type":"text","additional_properties":{"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"UST maintains its dollar peg by burning or issuing LUNA tokens. When the value of UST drops below $1 (for example, to $0.98), holders of UST can convert UST to $1 worth of LUNA (therefore, arbitrageurs can pocket the $0.02 difference)."},{"_id":"ZTWBO6XSSBGXDMJ4ACPULIRRYY","type":"text","additional_properties":{"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Conversely, if - as appears to be occurring now - demand for UST drives the price of the token over $1, users can mint additional UST (driving the price of UST back down to $1) by burning the dollar-equivalent amount of LUNA. This burning of LUNA tokens to create UST drives up the price of LUNA."},{"_id":"XQI6ZQWLPZDDZELFYRSDMGZ53Y","type":"text","additional_properties":{"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"<b>Anchor Protocol driving UST demand</b>"},{"_id":"R42CQUT5WJFN7EILBQ7A3LHDOE","type":"text","additional_properties":{"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Behind that <a href=\"https://www.coindesk.com/markets/2022/03/03/anchor-protocols-anc-rallies-23-heres-why/\">strong demand is</a> Terras Anchor Protocol, a decentralized finance (DeFi) platform advertising an annualized percentage yield (APY) of nearly 20% on Terra stablecoins. That high yield compared to other stablecoin lending protocols has attracted an influx of capital into Terra in recent weeks. The total value locked (TVL) on the platform soared to $12.6 billion, making it the largest DeFi protocol by TVL in the Terra ecosystem, according to data provider DeFi Llama."},{"_id":"HBRHWGFNDVAIPBFROZCHO2ORFE","type":"text","additional_properties":{"comments":[],"inline_comments":[]},"content":"Anchor is currently paying out a 19.46% APY for users that lock up their UST in the protocol. The Luna Foundation Guard (LFG) tweeted last Saturday that it was minting the maximum amount of UST to keep up with demand."},{"type":"oembed_response","subtype":"twitter","_id":"G2EXNF5XV5AWVEB3NAMNQZTPEE","raw_oembed":{"url":"https://twitter.com/LFG_org/status/1500002957529690114","author_name":"LFG | Luna Foundation Guard","author_url":"https://twitter.com/LFG_org","html":"<blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\"><p lang=\"en\" dir=\"ltr\">Due to the high demand in UST, the maximum amount is being minted by the protocol everyday. readabilityObject.title: The US Can Make Bitcoin Mining Greener
readabilityObject.content:
The incoming administration of Joe Biden has an opportunity to take the global lead in green mining for digital assets. It is no secret that there is a geopolitical struggle brewing over new forms of cryptocurrencies both state-backed and private and the best location for new capital formation and technological advancements. To win this global competition, the new U.S. government must ensure more regulatory clarity for digital assets while also ensuring that the mining process, a tremendous drain on energy resources and a contributor to global warming, is done in an environmentally sensitive way.  

Some of the new administrations leaders should work together to make policies to encourage development in this burgeoning industry. The expected ascension of Gary Gensler, a former chairman of the Commodity Futures Trading Commission, to lead the Securities and Exchange Commission augurs well for a more enlightened and proactive approach by regulators concerning digital assets. After all, he just finished teaching a course on blockchain at MIT, sees the technology as a catalyst for change, and is viewed as a threat to the legacy financial system. Thats all good for the disruptive financial technologies. 

James Cooper is a Professor of Law and Associate Dean of Experiential Learning at California Western School of Law. He is moderating a panel for Digital Davos on Jan. 20 on ethics and technologies in developing countries.

Also, the naming of former Secretary of State John Kerry to a cabinet-level position as Special Presidential Envoy for Climate, is a signal of the new administrations commitment to tackling global climate change. He understands the importance of cryptocurrency. At the World Economic Forum three years ago this week, Kerry was quoted as saying cryptocurrency has got value. Together, these two appointees can ensure the country leads fintech development while preventing crypto mining from contributing to more greenhouse gases.  

A raft of projects abroad are already primed for success in the green mining space and can act as models for the United States. In 2019, Bitfury set up mining centers in Paraguay, home to South Americas biggest hydro-electric project the Itaipu Dam the worlds largest generator of renewable clean energy. The government in Asuncin has backed the Commons Foundations Golden Goose project, in its attempt to establish the region as the worlds largest crypto mining center. But there is a challenge to keep the Paraguay project itself from contributing to greenhouse gases given the intense heat that the tropical country faces year round. It would be counter-productive to use a lot of energy to cool the computers even if the energy was being produced by renewable sources.

Cost-effective mining centers based on renewable energy have also been established in Russias frozen lands of Siberia. The city of Norilsk is home to the mineral mining behemoth Norilsk Nickel but increasingly bitcoin mining is becoming an important economic driver. With temperatures in winter bottoming out at minus 40 degrees Celsius (which is roughly minus 40 degrees Fahrenheit), this is a perfect climate by which to keep computing machines cool. Its a lot cooler than Paraguay for sure.  

Nor should we forget about China, the home to over half the bitcoin miners in the world, the majority of whom are situated in Sichuan due to low energy costs, powered by hydro-electric facilities. That the area has recently suffered some of the worst flooding in 70 years, largely due to climate change, shows that irony is as much at play here as hash rates. Poolin, which controls the majority of BTC hash rate, has had trouble with consistent energy supplies and some of its mining farms have been inundated by monsoon floods. Even with the provinces vast hydro-electric capabilities, the authorities in the Peoples Republic of China have generally banned the digital asset industry shuttering mining, exchanges and industry conferences.  

A more secure and geographically proximate project is rolling out near the Churchill Falls hydro-electric plant in Labrador, a remote part of Eastern Canada. Pow.re, a Montreal-based company with investors from Asia, is taking advantage of the stranded energy that NL Hydro generates. This hydro-electric facility is long past emitting mercury traces, so the project meets many environmental protection and sustainable development goals. The temperature rarely exceeds 60 degrees Fahrenheit in the summer, ensuring that the machines stay cool. The only source of waste is heat which is a luxury in the sub-Arctic region where they are mining. 

And while bountiful and clean electricity are critical to providing hash rates that are cost effective and have little environmental impact, so are champions in major policy-making positions. The combination of Gensler and Kerry in the Biden administration can help position the United States at the forefront of green mining. President Biden promised to "build back better." Green mining is one such way. Private companies are getting in on this opportunity too: Square Crypto recently announced a $10 million fund to promote projects that use green energy for bitcoin mining. 

The U.S. government has much to gain by providing regulatory clarity for fintech and environmentally sound policies for cryptocurrency mining. If it does not, there are plenty of other countries to take the lead and profit accordingly.

DISCLOSURE

readabilityObject.textContent: The incoming administration of Joe Biden has an opportunity to take the global lead in green mining for digital assets. It is no secret that there is a geopolitical struggle brewing over new forms of cryptocurrencies  both state-backed and private  and the best location for new capital formation and technological advancements. To win this global competition, the new U.S. government must ensure more regulatory clarity for digital assets while also ensuring that the mining process, a tremendous drain on energy resources and a contributor to global warming, is done in an environmentally sensitive way.Some of the new administrations leaders should work together to make policies to encourage development in this burgeoning industry. The expected ascension of Gary Gensler, a former chairman of the Commodity Futures Trading Commission, to lead the Securities and Exchange Commission augurs well for a more enlightened and proactive approach by regulators concerning digital assets. After all, he just finished teaching a course on blockchain at MIT, sees the technology as a catalyst for change, and is viewed as a threat to the legacy financial system. Thats all good for the disruptive financial technologies.James Cooper is a Professor of Law and Associate Dean of Experiential Learning at California Western School of Law. He is moderating a panel for Digital Davos on Jan. 20 on ethics and technologies in developing countries.Also, the naming of former Secretary of State John Kerry to a cabinet-level position as Special Presidential Envoy for Climate, is a signal of the new administrations commitment to tackling global climate change. He understands the importance of cryptocurrency. At the World Economic Forum three years ago this week, Kerry was quoted as saying cryptocurrency has got value. Together, these two appointees can ensure the country leads fintech development while preventing crypto mining from contributing to more greenhouse gases.A raft of projects abroad are already primed for success in the green mining space and can act as models for the United States. In 2019, Bitfury set up mining centers in Paraguay, home to South Americas biggest hydro-electric project  the Itaipu Dam  the worlds largest generator of renewable clean energy. The government in Asuncin has backed the Commons Foundations Golden Goose project, in its attempt to establish the region as the worlds largest crypto mining center. But there is a challenge to keep the Paraguay project itself from contributing to greenhouse gases given the intense heat that the tropical country faces year round. It would be counter-productive to use a lot of energy to cool the computers even if the energy was being produced by renewable sources.Cost-effective mining centers based on renewable energy have also been established in Russias frozen lands of Siberia. The city of Norilsk is home to the mineral mining behemoth Norilsk Nickel but increasingly bitcoin mining is becoming an important economic driver. With temperatures in winter bottoming out at minus 40 degrees Celsius (which is roughly minus 40 degrees Fahrenheit), this is a perfect climate by which to keep computing machines cool. Its a lot cooler than Paraguay for sure.Nor should we forget about China, the home to over half the bitcoin miners in the world, the majority of whom are situated in Sichuan due to low energy costs, powered by hydro-electric facilities. That the area has recently suffered some of the worst flooding in 70 years, largely due to climate change, shows that irony is as much at play here as hash rates. Poolin, which controls the majority of BTC hash rate, has had trouble with consistent energy supplies and some of its mining farms have been inundated by monsoon floods. Even with the provinces vast hydro-electric capabilities, the authorities in the Peoples Republic of China have generally banned the digital asset industry  shuttering mining, exchanges and industry conferences.A more secure and geographically proximate project is rolling out near the Churchill Falls hydro-electric plant in Labrador, a remote part of Eastern Canada. Pow.re, a Montreal-based company with investors from Asia, is taking advantage of the stranded energy that NL Hydro generates. Thishydro-electric facility is long past emitting mercury traces, so the project meets many environmental protection and sustainable development goals. The temperature rarely exceeds 60 degrees Fahrenheit in the summer, ensuring that the machines stay cool. The only source of waste is heat  which is a luxury in the sub-Arctic region where they are mining.And while bountiful and clean electricity are critical to providing hash rates that are cost effective and have little environmental impact, so are champions in major policy-making positions. The combination of Gensler and Kerry in the Biden administration can help position the United States at the forefront of green mining. President Biden promised to "build back better."Green mining is one such way. Private companies are getting in on this opportunity too: Square Crypto recently announced a $10 million fund to promote projects that use green energy for bitcoin mining.The U.S. government has much to gain by providing regulatory clarity for fintech and environmentally sound policies for cryptocurrency mining. If it does not, there are plenty of other countries to take the lead and profit accordingly.DISCLOSUREThe leader in news and information on cryptocurrency, digital assets and the future of money, CoinDesk is a media outlet that strives for the highest journalistic standards and abides by a strict set of editorial policies.
